note.p: Birth: Brisbane House, Largs, Ayrshire, Scotland (23 July 1773)
Death: Brisbane House, Largs, Ayrshire (27 January 1860)

Career: Ensign, 38th Regiment (1789); Lieutenant (1792); Captain (1793); served in Flanders under the Duke of York; Major (1795); Brigadier General, army of the Peninsula (1812); Governor, New South Wales (1821-1826); Lieutenant General (1825); retired to Scotland; General (1841)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1860-1862 vol 11 pp iii-vii
Notes: DNB is source of 'Makdougall' spelling.
